why.title: Unconvinced about Feature Flags?
why.description: Feature flagging is a powerful technique where developers wrap a new feature in an if/then statement to gain greater control over its release and behavior.

benefits.title: Maximize Flag Benefits
benefits.description: Feature flags (also known as feature switches, feature toggles, conditional features, etc.) are a powerful technique that allows developers and teams to modify system behavior without changing the underlying code.

implementation.title: Minimize Implementation Debt
implementation.description: Feature Flags are like variables used in conditional statements. They allow you to toggle 'on or off' blocks of code, similar to commenting out code. This gives developers the flexibility to control the flow of their software and bypass features that are not ready for deployment.

branching.title: Feature Flags vs. Branching
branching.description: Feature branching allows developers to collaborate effectively around a central code base by keeping all changes to a specific feature in its own branch. By adding feature flags to the mix, feature branching becomes even more powerful and faster, separating feature release management from code deployment.

questions.title: Frequently Asked Questions
questions.description: Explore our collection of useful questions and answers about the {product}. If you don't find the answer to your question here, feel free to open a discussion on Github.

1.title: Have more questions? Can I chat with someone?
1.description: Of course! If you have additional questions, please contact us at support@basestack.co — we’re here to assist you.

2.title: Is there a discount for annual plans?
2.description: Yes, we provide annual discounts on all plans. Contact us for details.

3.title: Are {product} available at no cost?
3.description: {product} offers a free plan, perfect for getting started or for solo developers. It’s an ideal way to explore and test the waters before selecting the deployment option and team plan that best fit your needs.

4.title: Can I use Basestack Feature Flags, Basestack Forms and other Basestack Products separately, and how does pricing work for each?
4.description: Yes, each tool—Feature Flags, Forms, and others—operates independently with its own pricing. You only pay for what you need, and you can select different plans for each product to match your specific requirements. This flexibility lets you customize your experience without overpaying for unused features.

5.title: What’s your refund policy?
5.description: At Basestack, we offer refunds within 15 days of purchase if you’re not fully satisfied. Beyond that, refunds may still be considered for serious reasons—just reach out to us. With our generous free tier, you can test everything thoroughly beforehand, and you’re always free to cancel anytime.

6.title: Which payment provider does Basestack use?
6.description: We partner with Lemon Squeezy to handle all payments securely and efficiently. As our merchant of record, Lemon Squeezy manages transactions, tax compliance, and global payment methods, so you can focus on using our tools without the hassle.

7.title: What is Basestack, and who is it for?
7.description: Basestack is a suite of open-source tools—like Forms and Feature Flags—designed for solo developers, teams, and startups. Whether you’re building solo or scaling a business, you can self-host for free or use our hosted plans to streamline your workflow.

8.title: Is Basestack really free to use?
8.description: Yes, our open-source tools are free to self-host forever. You only pay if you opt for our hosted plans, which add convenience and support—perfect if you want to skip the setup.

9.title: How do I get started with Basestack?
9.description: It’s simple: choose your tool, decide to self-host or go hosted, and integrate it into your project. Check our docs for quick setup guides, or request a demo for a closer look.

10.title: What’s the Feedback tool, and when’s it coming?
10.description: Feedback is our upcoming tool to capture user insights, competing with platforms like Canny. It’s launching soon—stay tuned for updates or sign up to be notified!

11.title: How secure is Basestack?
11.description: Security is a priority. Self-hosted setups give you full control, while our hosted plans include robust protection like request filtering and data encryption to keep your projects safe.

12.title: What support do I get with Basestack?
12.description: Self-hosters tap into our open-source community and docs. Hosted plan users get priority support from our team—reach out anytime at support@basestack.com for help.

13.title: How does Basestack compare to competitors?
13.description: Unlike rigid platforms, Basestack offers open-source freedom and modular pricing. You get tailored tools like Forms and Feature Flags, plus a hosted option, all without bloated extras.

14.title: How often do you update Basestack tools?
14.description: We regularly roll out updates to keep our tools sharp and secure. Self-hosters can pull the latest from our repo, while hosted users get upgrades automatically—no effort required.

15.title: Can I use Basestack with my existing tech stack?
15.description: Yes, Basestack integrates easily with most setups. Forms work with basic HTML or JS, Feature Flags fit any codebase, and our docs guide you through the details.

16.title: Is there a trial for hosted plans?
16.description: Our free tier acts as your trial—test everything there first. Hosted plans don’t have a separate trial, but you can cancel within 15 days for a refund if it’s not a fit.

17.title: Why open-source and hosted together?
17.description: Open-source gives you control and no cost, while hosted offers convenience and support. Pick what suits you—Basestack adapts to your style, not the other way around.
